intro: Turraea pellegriniana, commonly known as the Pellegrin's turraea, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow and are accompanied by specialized structures called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Turraea pellegriniana is often found in moist, shaded environments within forest understories.
